definitions.definition: determined to be successful, rich, powerful, etc.

examples.text: They were very ambitious for their children *(= they wanted them to be successful)*.
I am very ambitious. Nothing means more to me than winning.
I'm not ambitious enough to try for the top.
She's a great student—dedicated, hardworking and ambitious.
The students are all ambitious to do well.

definitions.definition: needing a lot of effort, money or time to succeed

examples.text: the government’s **ambitious plans** for social reform
Jogging every morning? That’s very ambitious, isn’t it?
Several interns will be working on three ambitious new projects.
The book is ambitious in scope.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French ambitieux or Latin ambitiosus, from ambitio, from ambire ‘go around (canvassing for votes)’.
